intro: Trisetum tenue, commonly known as slender woodoat, is a perennial grass species native to North America. It typically grows in moist to wet habitats such as marshes, swales, and along stream banks. The plant has slender, erect stems that are often丛生, with small, narrow leaves that are usually hairless. Its inflorescence consists of a loose cluster of spikelets, each bearing a single floret. Trisetum tenue plays an important ecological role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
